docs.title: OHDSI Train-the-Trainer (Oncology-Focused)
docs.text:
Welcome to the OHDSI Train-the-Trainer Hub for oncology. This site hosts the full bootcamp curriculum, asynchronous tracks, hands-on exercises, community office hours, and reusable teaching materials.

Format

  • Two-day bootcamp (mix of 60–90 min modules)
  • Integrated sessions with persona-specific side exercises
  • Quarterly refreshers (Module 12)
  • Office hours and weekly community meetings for sustained support

Personas: vocabulary/terminology experts, statisticians new to OHDSI, SQL-oriented data scientists, and clinicians/residents using Atlas for cohort discovery.

Focus: oncology (breast & lung), observational epidemiology, decision support using OHDSI tools.

→ Start with Getting Started and Personas & Learning Paths, then proceed through Curriculum modules.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Prepare before Day 1 to get the most from the bootcamp.

docs.title: Pre-work (2–3 hours)
docs.text:
• Videos
  • OHDSI intro playlist: https://www.youtube.com/@OHDSI
  • Reading
  • Book of OHDSI – Chapter 1: The Journey of OHDSI https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/
  • Book of OHDSI – Common Data Model (CDM overview) https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/CommonDataModel.html
  • Community
  • Create an account on the OHDSI Forum: https://forums.ohdsi.org/
  • Browse OHDSI community/workgroups: https://ohdsi.org/community/

docs.title: Accounts & Tools
docs.text:
• Atlas: ensure access to your sandbox (ask your project admin)
  • GitHub: install GitHub Desktop or CLI and authenticate
  • Optional (code users): R (latest), RStudio/Posit, Python 3.10+

docs.title: Orientation Deck & SOPs
docs.text:
• (Add your project-specific links here)
  • “Where to ask?” cheat sheet (FAQ, contacts, forum tags)

docs.title: Knowledge Check (optional)
docs.text: A short pre-quiz (5–10 Qs) to verify readiness. (Link your quiz here)

docs.title: Personas & Learning Paths
docs.text: This curriculum is integrated, with side exercises per persona.

docs.title: Vocabulary / Terminology Experts
docs.text:
• Goal: apply vocab expertise using OHDSI tools (Athena, Atlas concept sets, Usagi).
  • Focus: Module 2 (vocab), Module 3 (mapping), Module 4 (DQD unmapped concepts).
  • Side exercise: build parent concept sets for breast/lung CA; review HER2 markers.

docs.title: Statisticians (new to OHDSI, tool-skeptical)
docs.text:
• Goal: connect OHDSI constructs to study design & validity.
  • Focus: Module 5 (epi/design), Module 4 (data quality), Module 6 (governance).
  • Side exercise: critique cohort design for confounding/misclassification.

docs.title: Data Scientists (SQL-oriented)
docs.text:
• Goal: programmatic access; reproducibility.
  • Focus: Module 2 (schema), Module 3 (ETL scripting), Module 5 (reproduce Atlas SQL), Module 8 (advanced SQL/ML).
  • Side exercise: export Atlas SQL, parameterize in R/Python; build CI scripts.

docs.title: Clinicians / Residents (limited time; Atlas-first)
docs.text:
• Goal: rapid cohort discovery and interpretation.
  • Focus: Module 5 (Atlas), Module 2 (concept search), Module 6 (privacy).
  • Side exercise: build a HER2+ breast cancer cohort, present 2–3 actionable findings.

docs.title: Resources (Curated)
docs.text: A handy library for trainers and self-service users.

docs.title: Oncology
docs.text: • Dr. Asieh Golozar and Large-Scale Observational Cancer Research Informatics Grand Rounds 10/13/22: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9-wB6e8Op7k

• OHDSI community guidance (search forum)

docs.title: 📚 Syllabus – OHDSI Train-the-Trainer (Oncology-Focused)
docs.text: This syllabus is the master reading & resource guide for the curriculum. It is organized in two ways: 1. By Module – mapped to Modules 00–12. 2. By Persona – tailored reading lists and exercises for vocabulary experts, statisticians, data scientists, and clinicians.

docs.title: Module 00 – Orientation
docs.text:
• Project charter & SOPs (internal)
  • OHDSI Forum – Introduce Yourself
  • RWD Guide – “Getting Started”

docs.title: Module 01 – Introduction to OHDSI & OMOP
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 1: The Journey of OHDSI
  • OHDSI Community
  • OHDSI YouTube: “What is OHDSI?” overview

docs.title: Module 02 – OMOP CDM & Vocabularies
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 2: Common Data Model
  • Athena vocabulary browser: https://athena.ohdsi.org/
  • Atlas User Guide – Concept Sets
  • Oncology WG forum: https://forums.ohdsi.org/tag/oncology

docs.title: Module 03 – ETL to OMOP
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 3: ETL
  • White Rabbit / Rabbit in a Hat: https://github.com/OHDSI/WhiteRabbit
  • Usagi: https://github.com/OHDSI/Usagi
  • OHDSI YouTube demo: White Rabbit

docs.title: Module 04 – Data Quality
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 4: Data Quality
  • Data Quality Dashboard: https://github.com/OHDSI/DataQualityDashboard
  • Kahn MG et al., A Harmonized Data Quality Assessment Framework. EGEMS

docs.title: Module 05 – Analytics & Observational Epidemiology
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 12: Population-Level Estimation
  • Book of OHDSI – Chapter 13: Patient-Level Prediction
  • Atlas: cohort & characterization features
  • RWD Guide – bias & confounding

docs.title: Module 06 – Security & Compliance
docs.text:
• OHDSI Forum privacy discussions
  • HIPAA/GDPR primers (external institutional links)

docs.title: Module 07 – Team Building
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 15: OHDSI Community
  • Agile project management (Scrum/Kanban primers)

docs.title: Module 08 – Advanced Topics
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 14: HADES and Packages
  • HADES suite: https://ohdsi.github.io/Hades/
  • OHDSI Oncology Extension docs
  • NLP WG materials (forum/wiki)

docs.title: Module 09 – Train-the-Trainer Skills
docs.text:
• Adult learning principles (link to EDUCAUSE brief)
  • OHDSI Symposium tutorial slide decks

docs.title: Module 10 – Capstone
docs.text:
• Reuse prior module resources + Atlas sandbox
  • Incorporate Book of OHDSI chapters relevant to chosen project

docs.title: Module 11 – Wrap-Up
docs.text:
• Feedback form (internal link)
  • OHDSI Weekly Calls & Events

docs.title: Module 12 – Refresher
docs.text:
• Latest OHDSI GitHub releases
  • Oncology WG updates

docs.title: Vocabulary / Terminology Experts
docs.text:
• Module 02 & 03 resources: CDM schema, vocabularies, ETL
  • Atlas, Usagi, and other software tutorials
  • Oncology Extension vocab guides
  • Vocabulary WG forum threads

docs.title: Statisticians
docs.text:
• Module 04 & 05 resources: Data Quality, Estimation, Prediction
  • RWD Guide – bias, confounding, study design
  • Methods WG forum

docs.title: Data Scientists
docs.text:
• Module 02 & 08: schema deep-dive & advanced topics
  • HADES packages: CohortMethod, FeatureExtraction, PLP
  • Atlas → SQL export walkthroughs
  • GitHub repos for OMOP CDM & Atlas

docs.title: Clinicians / Residents
docs.text:
• Module 05: Atlas for cohort discovery
  • OHDSI YouTube tutorials (Atlas demos)
  • Oncology-specific case studies (breast & lung)
  • FAQ & cheat sheets

docs.title: ✅ How to Use This Page
docs.text:
• Trainers: Use the By Module list when preparing each bootcamp session.
  • Learners: Use the By Persona lists for self-paced study after the bootcamp.
  • Both: Bookmark RWD Guide and the Book of OHDSI as ongoing reference texts.

docs.title: Living FAQ
docs.text: Use this page to capture recurring Q&As from office hours and weekly meetings.

docs.title: Template
docs.text:
• Question:
  • Short Answer:
  • Steps / Guidance:
  • Links:
  • Last Updated: YYYY-MM-DD
  • Tags: #atlas #vocab #etl #dq #privacy #oncology

docs.title: How do I find all relevant concepts for "breast cancer" in Atlas?
docs.text: Short Answer: Use Concept Sets with parent SNOMED concepts, include descendants. Steps: Search "breast cancer" → open concept → "Add descendants" → review excludes. Links: Atlas user guide; Athena browser Tags: #atlas #vocab #oncology

docs.title: Why does my cohort count look too low?
docs.text: Short Answer: Check inclusion criteria dates, concept set coverage, and ETL completeness. Steps: (1) broaden date window, (2) verify concept set descendants, (3) review DQD unmapped % Tags: #atlas #dq #etl

docs.title: Office Hours (Ad Hoc)
docs.text: Purpose: Just-in-time support for self-service OHDSI/Atlas users.

docs.title: Cadence
docs.text: • Weekly or bi-weekly; 30–60 minutes; rotating hosts (vocab, analytics, ETL).

docs.title: Agenda Template
docs.text:
1. Welcome & ground rules (5m)
  2. Rapid round: each attendee states one question (10–15m)
  3. Deep-dive Q&A / live demos (15–30m)
  4. Capture takeaways & assign follow-ups (5–10m)

docs.title: Roles
docs.text: • Facilitator • Expert on Call • Note-taker

docs.title: Deliverables
docs.text:
• Add Q/As to Living FAQ and update cheat sheets.

Tip: Encourage synthetic data for screen shares. Avoid PHI.

docs.title: Weekly Community Meeting
docs.text: Purpose: Alignment, knowledge sharing, and momentum.

docs.title: Standing Agenda (60m)
docs.text:
1. Updates (10m): sites onboarded, tool/version notes, upcoming deadlines
  2. Lightning talk (15–20m): e.g., "HER2+ breast cancer cohort in Atlas"
  3. Discussion & Q&A (15–20m): challenges, cross-site learnings
  4. Resources & next steps (10m): workgroups, forum threads, office hours
  5. Wrap (5m): recap, owners, due dates

docs.title: Roles
docs.text: • Chair/Moderator • Presenter (rotates) • Community Connector • Note-taker

docs.title: Archives
docs.text: • Post notes/recordings here for reuse.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Project-specific context, roles, SOPs, and how to get help. Asynchronous pre-work.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Understand project goals, trainer role, and support pathways
  • Locate SOPs, cheat sheets, and escalation routes
  • Complete pre-work quiz

docs.title: Pre-Reads
docs.text:
• Welcome video (leadership) – (Add link)
  • Project charter & roles – (Add link)
  • SOPs: "If I have a question about X, I should ask Y" – (Add link)
  • FAQ & cheat sheet – (Add link)

docs.title: Key Resources
docs.text:
• OHDSI Forum: https://forums.ohdsi.org/
  • Community/workgroups: https://ohdsi.org/community/

docs.title: Exercise
docs.text: • Review a real site scenario (e.g., mapping pathology codes) and outline who you'd contact and where you'd look first.

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • You know the mission, your role, and where to find help fast.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: History, mission, and why the OMOP CDM enables scale, reproducibility, and federation.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Explain OHDSI’s mission and community
  • Describe what OMOP CDM is and why it matters
  • Navigate essential OHDSI resources

docs.title: Pre-Reads
docs.text:
• Book of OHDSI – Chapter 1 (TOC homepage): https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/
  • Community overview: https://www.ohdsi.org/community/

docs.title: Key Resources
docs.text:
• Atlas docs: https://ohdsi.github.io/Atlas/
  • EHDEN Academy (foundational courses): https://academy.ehden.eu/

docs.title: Discussion
docs.text: • “How would a common data model accelerate your oncology projects?”

docs.title: Persona Tips
docs.text:
• Statisticians: anchor to study validity benefits
  • Data Scientists: highlight schema + reproducible pipelines
  • Clinicians: focus on fast cohort discovery

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Shared model + shared tools = sharable, reproducible evidence.

docs.title: Module 02 · OMOP CDM Architecture & Standardized Vocabularies
Overview
docs.text: Core tables, relationships, standard vs source concepts, and concept hierarchies.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Read the CDM schema at a high level
  • Use concept search (Athena/Atlas) to build robust concept sets
  • Understand oncology-relevant concepts (e.g., histology, biomarkers)

docs.title: Pre-Reads
docs.text: • Book of OHDSI – Common Data Model: https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/CommonDataModel.html

docs.title: Key Resources
docs.text:
• Athena browser: https://athena.ohdsi.org/
  • Atlas concept sets: https://ohdsi.github.io/Atlas/

docs.title: Hands-on (Oncology)
docs.text:
• Build a breast cancer concept set: include descendants.
  • Add HER2 status via measurements/markers where available.
  • Repeat for lung cancer (NSCLC vs SCLC).

docs.title: Persona Tips
docs.text:
• Vocab Experts: lead concept hierarchy building
  • Statisticians: check clinical face validity & completeness
  • Data Scientists: export concept IDs for SQL pipelines
  • Clinicians: sanity check clinical coverage

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Strong concept sets = reliable cohorts and analyses.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Source data profiling, mapping, and loading with OHDSI tools.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Profile sources (White Rabbit), design mappings (Rabbit in a Hat)
  • Map local codes (Usagi/Athena)
  • Document ETL and handle missing/inconsistent data

docs.title: Key Resources
docs.text:
• White Rabbit / Rabbit in a Hat: https://github.com/OHDSI/WhiteRabbit
  • Usagi: https://github.com/OHDSI/Usagi

docs.title: Hands-on (Mini-Mapping)
docs.text:
• Map sample ICD-10-CM and local terms to standard concepts (breast/lung CA).
  • Decide target tables/fields (Condition, Procedure, Measurement).

docs.title: Persona Tips
docs.text:
• Vocab: resolve unmapped; maintain mapping logs
  • Data Sci: parameterize transforms; version ETL
  • Statisticians/Clinicians: understand ETL implications for analysis

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Documented, transparent ETL underpins trustable analytics.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Apply the Kahn framework (conformance, completeness, plausibility) and run DQD.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Interpret DQD results and triage issues
  • Close the loop with ETL for remediation
  • Communicate quality to stakeholders

docs.title: Key Resources
docs.text: • Data Quality Dashboard: https://github.com/OHDSI/DataQualityDashboard

docs.title: Hands-on (Triage)
docs.text: • Review a DQD summary (sample provided) and prioritize fixes (e.g., unmapped concepts, implausible dates).

docs.title: Persona Tips
docs.text:
• Vocab: attack unmapped concept clusters
  • Data Sci: write validation SQL; automate DQD runs
  • Statisticians: assess analytic impact of gaps
  • Clinicians: sanity check clinical plausibility

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Quality is a program, not a checkbox; document decisions.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Characterization, estimation, prediction; cohort design in Atlas with oncology focus.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Build Atlas cohorts and run characterization/incidence
  • Recognize bias/confounding; plan mitigation
  • Reproduce Atlas SQL in code for transparency

docs.title: Pre-Reads
docs.text:
• Estimation: https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/PopulationLevelEstimation.html
  • Prediction: https://ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/PatientLevelPrediction.html

docs.title: Key Resources
docs.text:
• Atlas docs: https://ohdsi.github.io/Atlas/
  • HADES index: https://ohdsi.github.io/Hades/

docs.title: Hands-on (Oncology)
docs.text:
• Cohort: HER2+ breast cancer treated with trastuzumab (last 5y).
  • Characterize demographics/comorbidities; simple incidence.
  • Optional: define a lung cancer immunotherapy cohort.

docs.title: Persona Tips
docs.text:
• Vocab: ensure concept set coverage (descendants)
  • Statisticians: scrutinize time-at-risk, new-user designs
  • Data Sci: export and run SQL; script reproducible runs
  • Clinicians: interpret outputs clinically; propose next questions

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Good design + robust cohorts → credible observational evidence.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Principles, HIPAA/GDPR considerations, federated analyses, and safe sharing.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Explain privacy-by-design in OMOP implementations
  • Distinguish local vs federated workflows
  • Communicate de-identification and result-sharing practices

docs.title: Resources
docs.text: • OHDSI Forum (privacy discussions): https://forums.ohdsi.org/

docs.title: Scenario
docs.text: • Address a site's concern: “Will Atlas expose our patient data?” Outline federation, local execution, aggregate sharing.

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Governance + transparency build partner trust and IRB confidence.

docs.title: Module 07 · Building & Managing the OMOP Team
Overview
docs.text: Roles (PM, ETL, vocab, analyst, clinician SME), collaboration, and timelines.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Define roles and responsibilities (RACI)
  • Plan milestones (mapping → DQD → 1st cohort)
  • Run effective trainer-led support

docs.title: Tools
docs.text: • GitHub (version control), shared docs, agile boards

docs.title: Exercise
docs.text: • Rescue plan for a delayed oncology ETL with an urgent cohort request.

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Clear ownership, short feedback cycles, and community help win the day.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Advanced SQL, ML/PLP, oncology extension awareness, FHIR interop, NLP/unstructured.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Recognize when to go beyond Atlas
  • Navigate oncology extension concepts/workflows
  • Know where to find advanced resources

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
• HADES: https://ohdsi.github.io/Hades/
  • PatientLevelPrediction: https://ohdsi.github.io/PatientLevelPrediction/
  • (Oncology WG tag) https://forums.ohdsi.org/tag/oncology

docs.title: Demos (optional)
docs.text:
• Complex SQL (overlaps, windows)
  • PLP quickstart on de-identified OMOP

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Trainers don’t need to master all areas—just know what’s possible and who/where to ask.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Adult learning, microteaching, adapting content to audiences, and using this site.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Plan short, outcome-focused sessions
  • Engage mixed-skill groups with side exercises
  • Curate & reuse materials; contribute improvements

docs.title: Toolkit
docs.text:
• Slide & checklist templates (add your links)
  • Agenda templates (see Office Hours, Weekly Meeting)

docs.title: Exercise
docs.text: • Microteaching: 3-minute demo (e.g., Atlas concept set basics). Peer feedback.

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • Empathy + clarity + hands-on = confident learners.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Design and present a mini training targeting a real site use-case.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• Define clear learning objectives
  • Assemble materials from this site + OHDSI resources
  • Deliver a short session and collect feedback

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• Build/interpret an oncology cohort in Atlas
  • Explain DQD triage to leadership
  • Intro to OMOP for clinicians

docs.title: Deliverables
docs.text:
• 10–15 min session plan and slides
  • 3–5 key resources (links) for learners
  • Reflection on improvements after feedback

docs.title: Recap & Feedback
docs.text:
• Quiz or discussion to surface any remaining gaps
  • Feedback survey (link)

docs.title: Certification
docs.text: • Criteria (attendance + capstone)

docs.title: Keep Learning
docs.text:
• Forums, workgroups, YouTube, EHDEN Academy
  • Office hours & weekly meetings (see Community)

docs.title: Takeaways
docs.text: • You’re ready to train and support OHDSI users—share your wins back to the community!

docs.title: Format
docs.text:
• Case presentations: “What would you do?”
  • Just-in-time mini-topics
  • Updates on tools/vocab/community

docs.title: Outcomes
docs.text:
• Unblock persistent issues
  • Share patterns and solutions
  • Keep trainers current and connected
